restype_order
=============

Index corresponds to the amino acid. Order is the same as the order of amino acids in `restypes` , where '20' represents the unknown amino acid number. 

+-----+-------+
| key | value |
+=====+=======+
| 0   | A     |
+-----+-------+
| 1   | R     |
+-----+-------+
| 2   | N     |
+-----+-------+
| 3   | D     |
+-----+-------+
| 4   | C     |
+-----+-------+
| 5   | Q     |
+-----+-------+
| 6   | E     |
+-----+-------+
| 7   | G     |
+-----+-------+
| 8   | H     |
+-----+-------+
| 9   | I     |
+-----+-------+
| 10  | L     |
+-----+-------+
| 11  | K     |
+-----+-------+
| 12  | M     |
+-----+-------+
| 13  | F     |
+-----+-------+
| 14  | P     |
+-----+-------+
| 15  | S     |
+-----+-------+
| 16  | T     |
+-----+-------+
| 17  | W     |
+-----+-------+
| 18  | Y     |
+-----+-------+
| 19  | V     |
+-----+-------+
| 20  | X     |
+-----+-------+
